description: Returns a PackageVersionDescription object that contains information about the requested package version.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The name of the domain that contains the repository that contains the package version.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository that contains the package version.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: A format that specifies the type of the requested package version.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace of the requested package version. The package component that specifies its namespace depends on its type. For example: The namespace of a Maven package version is its groupId. The namespace of an npm or Swift package version is its scope. The namespace of a generic package is its namespace. Python, NuGet, Ruby, and Cargo package versions do not contain a corresponding component, package versions of those formats do not have a namespace.

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: The name of the requested package version.

parameters.name: packageVersion
parameters.description: A string that contains the package version (for example, 3.5.2).

nested_items.name: packageVersion
nested_items.description: A PackageVersionDescription object that contains information about the requested package version.

nested_items.name: format
nested_items.description: The format of the package version.

nested_items.name: namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the package version. The package component that specifies its namespace depends on its type. For example:
The namespace of a Maven package version is its groupId.
The namespace of an npm or Swift package version is its scope.
The namespace of a generic package is its namespace.
Python, NuGet, Ruby, and Cargo package versions do not contain a corresponding component, package versions of those formats do not have a namespace.

nested_items.name: packageName
nested_items.description: The name of the requested package.

nested_items.name: displayName
nested_items.description: The name of the package that is displayed. The displayName varies depending on the package version's format. For example, if an npm package is named ui, is in the namespace vue, and has the format npm, then the displayName is @vue/ui.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the package.

nested_items.name: summary
nested_items.description: A summary of the package version. The summary is extracted from the package. The information in and detail level of the summary depends on the package version's format.

nested_items.name: homePage
nested_items.description: The homepage associated with the package.

nested_items.name: sourceCodeRepository
nested_items.description: The repository for the source code in the package version, or the source code used to build it.

nested_items.name: publishedTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that contains the date and time the package version was published.

nested_items.name: licenses
nested_items.description: Information about licenses associated with the package version.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: Name of the license.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The URL for license data.

nested_items.name: revision
nested_items.description: The revision of the package version.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: A string that contains the status of the package version.

nested_items.name: domainEntryPoint
nested_items.description: A DomainEntryPoint object that contains information about from which repository or external connection the package version was added to the domain.

nested_items.name: repositoryName
nested_items.description: The name of the repository that a package was originally published to.

nested_items.name: externalConnectionName
nested_items.description: The name of the external connection that a package was ingested from.

nested_items.name: originType
nested_items.description: Describes how the package version was originally added to the domain. An INTERNAL origin type means the package version was published directly to a repository in the domain. An EXTERNAL origin type means the package version was ingested from an external connection.
